info.title: Live API Reference
info.description: Reference for the Brightcove Live API, used to create and manage live streaming events.

400.description: BAD_REQUEST: Invalid input value - see Live API Error Messages for more details

401.description: UNAUTHORIZED: Unauthorized - see Live API Error Messages for more details

404.description: RESOURCE_NOT_FOUND: The api couldn't find the resource you requested - see Live API Error Messages for more details

500.description: INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR: see Live API Error Messages for more details

parameters.name: start_token
parameters.description: Next token from previous page; do not specify when fetching first page

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Max number of jobs to return in one request (1-1000, default is 10)

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Attribute to sort jobs by (`created_at` | `modified_at`, default is `created_at`)

parameters.name: sort_dir
parameters.description: Sort direction (default is asc):`asc` - ascending; `desc` - descending

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: Filter results by one or more user IDs

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Filter results by particular account, or specify ‘*’ to search all accounts.  Default value is account API key belongs to

parameters.name: created_at
parameters.description: Filter results by Unix time of job creation (in milliseconds)

parameters.name: modified_at
parameters.description: Filter results by Unix time of job last modified (in milliseconds)

parameters.name: ad_insertion
parameters.description: Filter results by is SSAI enabled

parameters.name: static
parameters.description: Filter results by has static endpoint

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Filter results by one or more job states

parameters.name: ssai_state
parameters.description: Filter results by one or more SSAI states

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: Filter results by one or more regions

500.description: INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR: DB getItem, no results found - see Live API Error Messages for more details

post.description: Inserts an ID3 timed metadata tag for an ongoing job. Note that: 1) If using timecode property, the job only stores the most recent request for insertion; 2) If using timecode property, the encoder must be sending SMPTE-formatted (HH:MM:SS:FF) timecode stored in the tc property via OnFI

requestBody.description: Inserts an ID3 timed metadata tag for an ongoing job. Note that: 1) If using timecode property, the job only stores the most recent request for insertion; 2) If using timecode property, the encoder must be sending SMPTE-formatted (HH:MM:SS:FF) timecode stored in the tc property via OnFI

schema.description: Inserts an ID3 timed metadata tag for an ongoing job. Note that: 1) If using timecode property, the job only stores the most recent request for insertion; 2) If using timecode property, the encoder must be sending SMPTE-formatted (HH:MM:SS:FF) timecode stored in the tc property via OnFI

slate_msa_id.description: The id for the Slate media source asset

beacon_set_id.description: The id for the beacon set

live_job_id.description: The id of Live Stream job to create the VOD clip from.

duration.description: Duration of the clip in seconds

stream_start_time.description: Start time in seconds for the clip relative to the start time of the live stream

stream_end_time.description: End time in seconds for the clip relative to the start time of the live stream

stream_start_timecode.description: Start for the clip as an SMPTE timecode for the live stream

stream_end_timecode.description: End for the clip as an SMPTE timecode for the live stream

start_time.description: Start time for the clip in Epoch (Unix) time (seconds)

end_time.description: End time for the clip in Epoch (Unix) time (seconds)

credentials.description: The name of the credentials configured in your account for this address - A credential label for a valid client id + client secret should have been created when your Live account was set up, the credential label sent to you. If you do not have it, please Contact Brightcove Support

videocloud.description: An object containing inputs for Video Cloud ingestion

video.description: An object containing inputs for Video Cloud video object creation - see the [CMS API Reference](https://brightcovelearning.github.io/Brightcove-API-References/cms-api/v1/doc/swagger.html#operations-Videos-CreateVideo)

ingest.description: An object containing inputs for Video Cloud video ingestion - see the [Dynamic Ingest Reference](https://brightcovelearning.github.io/Brightcove-API-References/dynamic-ingest-api/v1/doc/swagger.html#operations-Ingest-AccountsVideosIngestRequestsByAccountIdAndVideoIdPost) - do not include the master field, as that information will be provided by the Live API

tags.description: Array of tags for the video - note that  tags are string that may not contain a comma

reference_id.description: Reference id for the clip - must be unique within the account

state.description: Whether the video should be active or inactive

custom_fields.description: An object whose properties are `fieldname`:`value` pairs - be sure to the *internal* name of the field

drm_disabled.description: Use to disable DRM packaging for this video - applies only to DRM-enabled accounts

long_description.description: A longer description of the video

x-enum-elements.name: AD_SUPPORTED
x-enum-elements.description: Ad supported - this option can only be selected in the Brightcove account is ad-enabled

x-enum-elements.name: INACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description: Video is not available for playback

time.description: time of the cue point in seconds; example: 10.527

force-stop.description: whether video is force-stopped at the cue point

metadata.description: optional metadata string (512 single-byte characters maximum)

x-enum-elements.name: AD
x-enum-elements.description: A cue point to trigger an add request

x-enum-elements.name: CODE
x-enum-elements.description: A code cue point to be handled by a script

countries.description: array of ISO 3166 list of 2-letter codes(https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#home) (search for "country codes")

exclude_countries.description: if true, country array is treated as a list of countries excluded from viewing

restricted.description: whether geo-restriction is enabled for this video

ends_at.description: end date-time of availability in ISO-8601(http://www.ecma-international.org/ecma-262/5.1/#sec-15.9.1.15) format

starts_at.description: start date-time of availability in ISO-8601(http://www.ecma-international.org/ecma-262/5.1/#sec-15.9.1.15) format

profile.description: The ingest profile to use - we recommend that you do **not** include this field and use the account default profile instead

capture-images.description: Whether Video Cloud should capture poster and thumbnail images at the midpoint of the clip

callbacks.description: An array of URLs that nofications for the ingest job should be sent to

user_id.description: GUID for which the credentials are being created.

credential_default_for_type.description: Whether these are the default credentials for the request type

credential_private.description: Private key or password depending on the type

credential_public.description: Public key or password depending on the type

oauth_settings.description: OAuth settings for OAuth credentials needed to send notifications to a notification URL Required for oauth type credentials

url.description: OAuth access token URL for OAuth credentials needed to send notifications to a notification URL

credential_private.description: The private key for the credential (not shown; represented by asterisks)

label.description: The label used to reference the credential in requests

credential_public.description: The public key for the credential

user_id.description: GUID for which the credentials are being created.

credential_default_for_type.description: Whether these are the default credentials for the request type

credential_private.description: Private key or password depending on the type

credential_public.description: Public key or password depending on the type

oauth_settings.description: OAuth settings for OAuth credentials needed to send notifications to a notification URL Required for oauth type credentials

url.description: OAuth access token URL for OAuth credentials needed to send notifications to a notification URL

id.description: The job id for the stream that was activated
The job id for the stream that was stopped

live_stream.description: Indicates that the job is a live streaming job.

region.description: AWS region - you can also specify region as the alias for a list set up for the account by Brightcove Support. See [Supported AWS Regions] (https://support.brightcove.com/overview-brightcove-live-api#Support_aws_regions) for more details on the support in each region.

rtmp_ip_whitelist.description: Array of IP addresses white-listed for RTMP delivery

channel_type.description: Indicates whether the job should be billed as `event` hours or a channel (`24x7`) - see [Channels and Event Hours](https://support.brightcove.com/overview-brightcove-live-api#Channels_and_hours).

hls_endlist.description: Whether an `EXT-X-ENDLIST` tag should be added to the stream playlist when you stop the stream or the `reconnect_time` window has been reached. The `EXT-X-ENDLIST` tag indicates that no more Media Segments will be added to the Media Playlist file and helps prevent the player from displaying error messages when the stream stops.

outputs.description: Array of output specifications for live and VOD assets to be created from the live stream.

ad_insertion.description: Setting this parameter to true will enable server side ad insertion (SSAI) on the job. Current support includes, DFP, Freewheel, or any VAST 2.0/3.0 ad tags.

ad_audio_loudness_level.description: Adjust the loudness level of the audio. This is measured in LUFS and specified in dB. This is useful to set the output loudness level to conform to a standard (-23dB for EBU R.128) The recommended setting is -23.

beacon_set.description: ID for a beacon set (for SSAI only).

reconnect_time.description: The time, in seconds, to wait for a stream to reconnect to the encoder. If the reconnect time passes without the stream reconnecting, the job will automatically finish.

slate.description: Id for a set of slate assets

static.description: Whether this is a static entry point (SEP) job

encryption.description: Encryption to apply to the stream.

event_length.description: Used to preset and define an end time for the live event. At any point within the specified `event_length` you may reconnect to your stream. The `event_length` setting goes into effect as soon as streaming begins.

live_dvr_sliding_window_duration.description: The time, in seconds, to keep in the live DVR manifest. If the stream duration is longer than the window duration, segment references will be removed first in first out. Default is 100 seconds. **Note: for SSAI jobs, the limit is `7200`.

live_dvr_ads_window_duration.description: The time, in seconds, to keep in the live DVR manifest. If the stream duration is longer than the window duration, segment references will be removed first in first out. Default is `100` seconds.

max_hls_protocol_version.description: Sets the maximum HLS protocol version to use. Special features will be used as available. Default is `3`.

event.description: The type of event to send notifications for

notifications.description: Array of notification destination objects or strings - notifications defined here are for job-level events.  A notification will be sent to the destination when selected event occurs. You can use a simple string with a url: "http://log:pass@httpbin.org/post", or you can use an object. See [Events](https://support.brightcove.com/live-api-notifications#Events) for an explanation of the events reported in `state_changed` notifications.

add_cdns.description: Array of additional CDN providers to be used for manifest generation. For each CDN provided, the manifest will be prepended accordingly

type.description: The encryption type, depending on whether an internal or external key server will be used.

key.description: The encryption key - either a `key`, `passphrase`, or `key_rotation` is required; if the type is `external`, `key` is required

passphrase.description: The encryption key - either a `key`, `passphrase`, or `key_rotation` is required

key_rotation.description: Whether to use key rotation - either a `key`, `passphrase`, or `key_rotation` is required

rotate_every.description: Interval for key rotation in video segments

external_url.description: The URL for the external encryption key - this field is required if you specify type as external, and the external key must match the `key` value

label.description: A label to identify the CDN.

prepend.description: CDN hostname to be prepended to addresses

protocol.description: Protocol to use for the stream delivery

auth_type.description: Token authentication type - currently, the only supported value is `Akamai2.0`

start_time.description: The time to apply token auth - "now" or epoch time in seconds

end_time.description: The time to end token auth, epoch time in seconds

ttl.description: The time to live in seconds - either `end_time` or `ttl` is required

label.description: Label for the live or VOD asset.

live_stream.description: For jobs, setting live_stream to true indicates the output is a live rendition. If live_stream is false, or is not set, the output will be treated as a VOD output.

keyframe_interval.description: The maximum number of frames between each keyframe. If you set a low keyframe_interval it will increase the size / decrease the quality of your output file, but it will allow more precise scrubbing in most players. It’s recommended to have at least one keyframe per segment. If keyframe_interval is not provided, keyframes will follow the input GOP structure.

audio_bitrate.description: An output bitrate setting for the audio track, in Kbps

segment_seconds.description: Sets the maximum duration of each segment in a segmented output.

duration.description: Clipping API option 1. Duration (in seconds) to clip back from Live. Note: Clipping API only requires one of the three options for specifying duration or time.

ad_audio_loudness_level.description: Adjust the loudness level of the audio. This is measured in LUFS and specified in dB. This is useful to set the output loudness level to conform to a standard (-23dB for EBU R.128) The recommended setting is -23.

stream_start_time.description: Clipping API option 2. An offset, in seconds, from the start of the live stream to mark the beginning of the clip. Note: Clipping API only requires one of the three options for specifying duration or time.

stream_end_time.description: Clipping API option 2. An offset, in seconds, from the start of the live stream to mark the end of the clip. Note: Clipping API only requires one of the three options for specifying duration or time.

start_time.description: Clipping API option 3. Universal epoch time, in seconds, to mark the beginning of the clip. Note: Clipping API only requires one of the three options for specifying duration or time.

end_time.description: Clipping API option 3. Universal epoch time, in seconds, to mark the end of the clip. Note: Clipping API only requires one of the three options for specifying duration or time.

copy_video.description: Specifying copy_video will take the video track from the input video file and transmux it into the resulting output file.

copy_audio.description: Specifying copy_audio will take the audio track from the input video file and transmux it into the resulting output file.

skip_video.description: Specifying skip_video removes the video track.

skip_audio.description: Specifying skip_audio removes the audio track.

width.description: Video frame width. If no width is supplied, we will use 640 pixels.

height.description: Video frame height. If no height is supplied, we will use 480 pixels.

video_codec.description: The output video codec. Note: Only `h264` is supported.

h264_profile.description: H.264 has three commonly-used profiles: Baseline (lowest), Main, and High. Lower levels are easier to decode, but higher levels offer better compression. For the best compression quality, choose High. For playback on low-CPU machines or many mobile devices, choose `baseline`.

audio_codec.description: The output audio codec to use. Note: Only `aac` is supported.

event.description: The type of event to send notifications for

notifications.description: Array of notification destination objects or strings - notifications defined here are for job-level events.  A notification will be sent to the destination when selected event occurs. You can use a simple string with a url: "http://log:pass@httpbin.org/post", or you can use an object. See [Events](https://support.brightcove.com/live-api-notifications#Events) for an explanation of the events reported in `state_changed` notifications.

rendition_label.description: Indicates what rendition to use to create a VOD output (from the live job) or which renditions to use. By default, the system uses any transmuxed rendition or the highest resolution output if there is no transmuxed output.

type.description: The only type supported is a playlist. This is used for generating multiple master playlists with different renditions in the HLS manifest with the defined stream labels.

streams.description: When creating a playlist, the streams field is used to define which output renditions (by label) should be included in the manifest. Example format [{"source": "1080p"}, {"source": "720p"}].

url.description: For VOD, URL is mandatory and sets the destination of the final asset destination. For access restricted origins, the credentials a can be passed along with the URL or stored within the Brightcove system. For Live, this is reserved for future use.

credentials.description: The name for credentials with private and public keys can be stored with Brightcove to avoid passing plain text on API requests. This is required if the S3 or FTP origins are restricted. If credentials are not provided, it will be assumed that the origin restrictions are set to public or credentials are passed along with the URL.

videocloud.description: Video Cloud customer have the option to push their clips directly through Dynamic Ingest. Options "{"video": {"name"}, "ingest": { }". The video object will be sent to the CMS API and can include (description, tags, etc.). Note: the account_id and reference_id will be added automatically. If overriding the reference_id, ensure that the id does not already exist or the job will fail. For more information see: CMS-API-CreateVideo. The ingest object will be sent to the Dynamic Ingest API and can include (master, profile, poster, callbacks, etc). Note: the account_id and video_id are added automatically. For more information see: DI-API-IngestVideo.

event.description: Event to send the notification for.

credentials.description: Credentials The name of the credentials configured in your account for this address

event.description: Event to send the notification for.

credentials.description: Credentials The name of the credentials configured in your account for this address

stream_url.description: The stream URL to add to your encoder configuration.

stream_name.description: The stream name to add to your encoder configuration.

outputs.description: Details on each output rendition of the Live job.

live_stream.description: Indicates that the job is a live streaming job.

ad_insertion.description: Setting this parameter to true will enable server side ad insertion (SSAI) on the job. Current support includes, DFP, Freewheel, or any VAST 2.0/3.0 ad tags.

region.description: You can specify an Amazon AWS region to use for encoding a job and we will process the job on servers in the region specified. It’s recommended to use the region closest to your encoder.

reconnect_time.description: The time, in seconds, to wait for a stream to reconnect to the encoder. Default is set to 30 seconds.

event_length.description: Used to preset and define an end time for the live event. At any point within the specified event_length you may reconnect to your stream. The event_length setting goes into effect as soon as streaming begins.

max_hls_protocol_version.description: Sets the maximum HLS protocol version to use. Special features will be used as available. Default is 3.

slate.description: id for slate of assets to be included

sep_state.description: The current state of the job's SEP (static entry point) - possible values: 'waiting' 'pending_activation', 'activation_in_progress', 'ready', 'pending_deactivation', 'deactivation_in_progress', 'cancelled', 'finished'

notifications.description: Array of notification destination objects or strings.  A notification will be sent to the destination when selected event occurs. You can use a simple string with a url: "http://log:pass@httpbin.org/post", or you can use an object.

add_cdns.description: Array of additional CDN providers to be used for manifest generation. For each CDN provided, the manifest will be prepended accordingly

next_token.description: Use as start_token to fetch next page.  Not include if no more matching jobs.

start_token.description: Returns start_token from current request (not included on first page).

vod_jobs.description: The filtered list of jobs.  List may be empty if no matching jobs or for last page.

id.description: The unique id for the rendition.

playback_url.description: Media HLS manifest for the specified rendition (non-SSAI).

playback_url_dvr.description: Media HLS manifest for the specified rendition (with DVR capability).

playback_url_vod.description: Media HLS manifest for the VOD version of the stream if one was specified in the job settings - note that the VOD will not be available until the live event has finished and the creation of the VOD is complete.

label.description: A label to identify the CDN.

prepend.description: Typically, a domain or path to prepend to addresses

protocol.description: Protocol to use in sending the stream to the CDN.

credentials.description: Credentials for the destination, if required.

event.description: Event type to send notifications for.  It’s recommended to set events on the job and not individual rendition outputs since renditions will finish simultaneously.

id.description: The job id for the stream that was Deactivated

region.description: The Amazon AWS region to use for encoding the job

reconnect_time.description: The time, in seconds, that the system will wait for a stream to reconnect to the encoder

event_length.description: Used to preset and define an end time for the live event. At any point within the specified event_length you may reconnect to your stream. The event_length setting goes into effect as soon as streaming begins.

live_stream.description: Indicates whether this is a live stream or VOD

input_media_file.description: Object containing properties for the input media file

slate.description: id for a slate of assets included

stream.description: Object containing properties for the live stream

output_media_files.description: Array of objects containing properties for the output media files

created_at.description: ISO 8601 date-time string representing when the job was created

finished_at.description: ISO 8601 date-time string representing when the live stream was stopped

state.description: The current state of the job - possible values for Live jobs are standby, waiting, processing, disconnected. finishing, finished, cancelling, cancelled, failed; possible values for VOD jobs are waiting_finish_live, waiting, processing, creating_asset, cancelling, cancelled, finished, failed

submitted_at.description: ISO 8601 date-time string representing when the job was submitted

updated_at.description: ISO 8601 date-time string representing when the job was last modified

playback_url.description: Playback URL for the live stream

playback_url_dvr.description: Playback URL for the live DVR

audio_bitrate_in_kbps.description: Audio bitrate of the input media file

audio_codec.description: Audio codec of the input media file

audio_sample_rate.description: Audio sample rate of the input media file

created_at.description: ISO 8601 date-time string representing when the input file was created

finished_at.description: ISO 8601 date-time string representing when the input file was finished

frame_rate.description: Frame rate of the input file

height.description: Frame height of the input file

id.description: System id of the input file

state.description: Current state of input file processing

updated_at.description: ISO 8601 date-time string representing when the input file was last modified

video_bitrate_in_kbps.description: Video bitrate of the input media file

video_codec.description: Video codec of the input media file

width.description: Frame width of the input media file

total_bitrate_in_kbps.description: Total bitrate of the input media file

url.description: URL for the input media file

created_at.description: ISO 8601 date-time string representing when the stream was created

duration.description: ISO Duration of the stream in seconds

finished_at.description: ISO 8601 date-time string representing when the stream was finished

updated_at.description: ISO 8601 date-time string representing when the stream was last modified

video_bitrate_in_kbps.description: Video bitrate of the input media file

video_codec.description: Video codec of the input media file

region.description: AWS region list specified for the account

location.description: Object representing the location of the stream

destination.description: Object representing the destination of the stream

audio_bitrate_in_kbps.description: Audio bitrate of the output media file

audio_codec.description: Audio codec of the output media file

audio_sample_rate.description: Audio sample rate of the output media file

duration_in_ms.description: ISO 8601 date-time string representing when the output file was created

frame_rate.description: Frame rate of the output file

height.description: Frame height of the output file

video_bitrate_in_kbps.description: Video bitrate of the output media file

video_codec.description: Video codec of the output media file

width.description: Frame width of the output media file

total_bitrate_in_kbps.description: Total bitrate of the output media file

keyframe_interval.description: Keyframe interval for the output media file

keyframe_interval_follow_source.description: Whether keyframe rate for the output matches the source

live_stream.description: Whether the output is a live stream

type.description: Will be playlist for playlist output

filename.description: File name for the playlist manifest

dvr_filename.description: File name for the DVR playlist manifest

created_at.description: ISO 8601 date-time string representing when the output file was created

finished_at.description: ISO 8601 date-time string representing when the output file was finished

id.description: System id of the output file

state.description: Current state of output file processing

updated_at.description: ISO 8601 date-time string representing when the output file was last modified

playback_url_dvr.description: Live DVR url for live stream output

id3_tag.description: An object containing variables for the ID3 timed metadata

value.description: A value for the tag (maximum string data size 256KB)

timecode.description: Time to insert - by default, insertion is immediate - Note: 1) If you use the timecode property, the job only only stores the most recent request for insertion; 2) If you use the timecode property, the encoder must be sending SMPTE-formatted (HH:MM:SS:FF) timecode stored in the tc property via OnFI; 3) Software encoders such as Wirecast and OBS do not support the sending timecode via OnFI packets in the RTMP stream; 4) Elemental hardware encoders do support the sending timecode via OnFI packets in the RTMP stream

duration.description: An integer value to indicate the length of the ad break in seconds

timecode.description: When to insert the cuepoint in HH:MM:SS:FF from the stream start (FF = frames); if omitted, the cuepoint will be inserted immediately

ad_server_data.description: a set of any variables (key/value pairs) that should be passed to the adServer

id.description: The id of the live stream job

accuracy.description: The cuepoint insertion accuracy - may be segment or frame

inserted_at.description: Time when the cue point was inserted in the stream

ad_configuration_url_format.description: Format for the ad tag - see SSAI Using the Brightcove Live API for the available ad configuration variables.

application_description.description: Human readable description of the ad application.

account_id.description: Your Live account id (if you leave this blank, the request will still work)

ad_configuration_description.description: Human readable description of the configuration.

ad_configuration_expected_response_type.description: The expected response type based on your ad server

ad_configuration_strategy.description: Specifies whether ad breaks should include single or muliple ads

ad_configuration_headers.description: An optional JSON object that can contain zero or more key-value-pairs, for which both key and value must be strings.  All of the standard URL substitutions are valid for headers.

ad_configuration_headers_for_impressions.description: If true, this configuration will send headers on all ad requests and impressions; if false, headers will not be sent on impressions (quartiles/impressions that we fire for tracking from an ad response).

application_ad_configuration.description: The ad configuration object for the application

response_type.description: The ad configuration response type (Dfp, Vast, or SmartXML)

ad_configuration_strategy.description: The ad configuration strategy (SingleAdResponse, or MultipleAdResponse)

ad_configuration_url_format.description: The URL template for the ad server

ad_configuration_variables.description: Key/value pairs for the ad server URL template

ad_configuration_headers_for_impressions.description: If true, this configuration will send headers on all ad requests and impressions; if false, headers will not be sent on impressions (quartiles/impressions that we fire for tracking from an ad response).

inserted.description: Whether the ad application was successfully inserted

beacon_url.description: URL format for the beacon - see ( https://support.brightcove.com/node/17763#Beacons) for the valid beacon variables

beacon_type.description: the beacon type - see ( https://support.brightcove.com/node/17763#Beacons) for the valid beacon types

inserted.description: Whether the beacon set was added successfully
Whether the ad application was successfully inserted

application_description.description: Human readable description of the ad application.

account_id.description: Your Live account id (if you leave this blank, the request will still work)

ad_configuration_description.description: Human readable description of the configuration.

ad_configuration_expected_response_type.description: The expected response type based on your ad server

ad_configuration_strategy.description: Specifies whether ad breaks should include single or muliple ads

ad_configuration_headers.description: An optional JSON object that can contain zero or more key-value-pairs, for which both key and value must be strings.  All of the standard URL substitutions are valid for headers.

ad_configuration_headers_for_impressions.description: If true, this configuration will send headers on all ad requests and impressions; if false, headers will not be sent on impressions (quartiles/impressions that we fire for tracking from an ad response).

inserted.description: Whether the ad application was successfully inserted

media_source_asset_default.description: Whether this is the default media source asset

media_source_asset_url.description: URL for the media asset to be ingested

media_source_asset_status.description: Current status of the ingestion of the media asset

deleted.description: Whether the beacon set was deleted successfully

account_id.description: URL for the slate to ingest

beacon_url.description: URL format for the beacon - see ( https://support.brightcove.com/node/17763#Beacons) for the valid beacon variables

beacon_type.description: the beacon type - see ( https://support.brightcove.com/node/17763#Beacons) for the valid beacon types

inserted.description: Whether the beacon set was added successfully
Whether the ad application was successfully inserted

media_source_asset_description.description: User identifiable description for the slate

media_source_asset_default.description: Whether this is the default media source asset

media_source_asset_url.description: URL for the media asset to be ingested

media_source_asset_status.description: Current status of the ingestion of the media asset

inserted.description: Whether the beacon set was added successfully
Whether the beacon set was added successfully

source_url.description: URL for the slate to ingest

account_id.description: The Live account id (if left blank, the request will still work)

source_description.description: User identifiable description for the slate

media_source_asset_description.description: User identifiable description for the slate

media_source_asset_default.description: Whether this is the default media source asset

media_source_asset_url.description: URL for the media asset to be ingested

media_source_asset_status.description: Current status of the ingestion of the media asset
